poem:
**Town Hall**

A voice among  
Pennsylvania leaves—  
questions hang  
like apples, ripe  
in distance—  
finished debates  
echo between  
tv glass and  
falling light.  
Here, the pause  
among breaths,  
hopes in flight,  
words like seeds  
in a restless  
autumn wind.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "What to know about the Kamala Harris town hall on CNN With 13 days until the election, Kamala Harris will answer voter questions during a live town hall on Wednesday evening. CNN will host the one-hour-and-15 minute event from Pennsylvania, a battleground state both the Harris and Trump campaigns need to win to secure the White House. The network previously extended an invitation to Harris and Trump for an October debate, which Trump declined and". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
